intro: Allantodia sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim allantodia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has a slender, erect stem and is often found in forested areas of Nepal, Bhutan, and India. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
